mdRecord.dcterms:description: View of house and driveway from side yard

Hollin Hills has approximately 450 houses conceived and built by...Robert C. Davenport, and designed by D.C.-based architect Charles M. Goodman...and landscape architect Dan Kiley. The community was one of the first post-World-War-II developments around Washington, D.C., and it is known primarily for its modern architecture, which is very cohesive because of a design review committee that advises on building or modification of existing houses. - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hollin_Hills [work]
